poem:
**Trade Winds**  

The markets dance in suits of green,  
at a nod from distant pen and screen.  
An ocean of numbers swells, recedes,  
with every whisper, every need.  

In the pause of tariffs, a brief reprieve,  
the world holds its breath, unsure to believe.  
In this daily waltz of buy and sell,  
the future's tangle only time will tell.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Trump’s China trade truce extension spurs market rally Donald Trumps’s decision to extend a truce in the trade war with China has triggered a stock market rally across the globe. On Monday night, Trump signed an executive order extending the deadline for higher tariffs on China until 10 November. Beijing said early on Tuesday that it will suspend additional tariffs on US goods for 90 more days. In response, markets in Japan and Australia hit". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
